text:
Q: awk to get certain next lines when a pattern is matched A:

Editing the reformatted version of OP's code:

{
        if ($2 == "untagged") {
                saved = $1
                next
        }
}

{
        if ($1 == "-") {
                $1 = saved
                print $1, $2
        }
}

Which looks like this when smashed into a one-liner:

{ if ($2 == "untagged") { saved = $1; next } } { if ($1 == "-") { $1 = saved; print $1, $2 } }

One alternative using an if/else construct:

{ if ($2 == "untagged")
     saved = $1
  else
     print saved,$2
}

Smashed into a one-liner:

{ if ($2 == "untagged") saved = $1; else print saved,$2 }

If the conditional only has a single command/action then the braces are optional; the same exact code with an explicit set of braces:

{ if ($2 == "untagged") {
     saved = $1
  }
  else {
     print saved,$2
  }
}

Smashed into a one-liner:

{ if ($2 == "untagged") { saved = $1 } else { print saved,$2} }

All of these:

<output of a command> | awk '{ if ($2 == "untagged") { saved = $1; next } } { if ($1 == "-") { $1 = saved; print $1, $2 } }'
<output of a command> | awk '{ if ($2 == "untagged") saved = $1; else print saved,$2 }'
<output of a command> | awk '{ if ($2 == "untagged") { saved = $1 } else { print saved,$2} }'

Generate the same output:

0:4:1 10
0:4:1 30
0:4:1 40
0:4:1 50
0:4:1 60
0:4:1 70
0:4:1 80
0:4:1 90
1:4:1 10
1:4:1 30
1:4:1 40
1:4:1 50
1:4:1 60
1:4:1 70
1:4:1 80
1:4:1 90

Q: The "Local Changes" tab does not show up in the IntelliJ IDEA Git tool window A:

Uncheck following:

Settings -> Version Control -> Commit -> Use non-modal commit interface

You should now see Local Changes tab inside Git.

In the 2025.01 version, this setting was moved to Preferences > Advanced Settings > Version Control > "Use modal commit interface for Git and Mercurial" (it also requires the "Modal Commit Interface" plugin to be enabled).
